channel.title: .Net on James Skemp's StrivingLife
channel.description: Recent content in .Net on James Skemp's StrivingLife

item.title: Review: Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5 Quickstart Cookbook (2013)
item.description: Review of Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5 Quickstart Cookbook (2013), written by Jose Luis Latorre Millas, and published by Packt Publishing.

item.title: Unofficial Xbox Live API wrappers
item.description: This morning I created two API wrappers for the Mashape implementations of XboxApi.com and XboxLeaders.com.

item.title: Review: Instant .NET 4.5 Extension Methods How-to (2013)
item.description: Review of Instant .NET 4.5 Extension Methods How-to (2013), written by Shawn R. McLean.

item.title: Excellent news - the BlogML project is not dead.
item.description: While it seemed to be near death, if not dead, at least as far as new releases, the BlogML project is not dead, and has been undergoing a number of needed changes since the end of January.

item.title: Convert online image to base64 with C#
item.description: Code to convert an image online to base64.

item.title: ASP.NET charts example: Odin Sphere: Part 3 - Creating the chart
item.description: In this final part of the series, we use data from an XML file to create a chart of leveling information for Odin Sphere characters.

item.title: ASP.NET charts example: Odin Sphere: Part 2 - Parsing the XML
item.description: In part two of a series on creating charts with ASP.NET, we grab an XML data file and populate our custom objects from part one with the necessary data.

item.title: ASP.NET charts example: Odin Sphere: Part 1 - Introduction and model
item.description: In this series we use data from Odin Sphere to create charts with ASP.NET. After a short introduction, part one creates the object model we'll populate from the data.

item.title: Tutorial: ASP.NET (C#) WCF WebHttp service with jQuery: Part 3 - Pulling JSON with jQuery
item.description: In this tutorial, leading up to a WCF WebHttp service that can be queried with jQuery, we complete our tutorial by modifying the WCF service to return JSON data to jQuery requests, and output that information to users.

item.title: Tutorial: ASP.NET (C#) WCF WebHttp service with jQuery: Part 2 - WCF WebHttp service
item.description: In this tutorial, leading up to a WCF WebHttp service that can be queried with jQuery, we use a WCF WebHttp template to quickly create a RESTful Web service, with a method to return loans for set data.

item.title: Tutorial: ASP.NET (C#) WCF WebHttp service with jQuery: Part 1 - Loan object
item.description: In this tutorial, leading up to a WCF WebHttp service that can be queried with jQuery, we create a simple loan object, with associated methods.

item.title: Tutorial: ASP.NET (C#) WCF WebHttp service with jQuery: Table of Contents
item.description: In the next week I'll be writing a tutorial on creating a RESTful Web service that can be consumed by jQuery and returns loan payoff information.

item.title: Vehicle gas DTD .NET objects and XML parsing with LINQ
item.description: Having created an XML document, with DTD, to store vehicle fillups, here's a look at a rough object and how to parse them out of XML via LINQ.

item.title: Music Recommendations Please! version 0.5 beta
item.description: Version 0.5 beta of Music Recommendations Please! is now available for download.

item.title: Basic .NET (C#) Traceroute library
item.description: A slightly enhanced version of Jim Scott's C# Traceroute.
